clues.text: This judge didn't need his hotel Bible when he & his men killed 120,000 Midianites
This biblical book with a female name records the killing of 75,000 Persians by the Jews
The Lord himself slew 50,070 "raiders" of Beth Shemesh for looking into this holy object
During the time of Samuel, the Israelites lost 30,000 soldiers fighting this neighboring group
II Kings recounts the slaughter by an angel of the Lord of 185,000 soldiers of this kingdom to the north of Israel

"With Or Without You",
"Pride (In the Name of Love)"

"What's The Frequency, Kenneth?",
"Losing My Religion"

"Deadbeat Club",
"Private Idaho"

"For Those About To Rock (We Salute You)",
"Dirty Deeds Done Dirt Cheap"

"Waterfalls",
"No Scrubs"
If Recife, in this S. Am. country, had been around 200 million years ago, you could have walked from it to what's now Africa
Lund in this Scandinavian country isn't named for Ilsa Lund; it was founded before the year 1000
This Asian country of 240 million people also has 17,500 islands
In 1856 American adventurer William Walker conquered this Central American country & ruled it as "president"
In this Asian nation bordering Russia & China, many rural people live in camel skin tents called yurts
Flutter & frog are types of this in swimming
This center is the center of the action for Space Shuttle launches
On July 24, 1959 he was the Soviet half of the "Kitchen Debate"
On the big screen he was billed as the "Eighth Wonder of the World"
This word meaning "praise" looks plural but is actually singular & should be used with a singular verb
In 1905, before he took up Cubism, this Spaniard painted his friend Gertrude Stein, who wore her favorite brown velvet coat
Augustus John, known for his portrait of this Welsh poet, introduced the poet to his future wife Caitlin
This British prime minister hated Graham Sutherland's 1954 portrait of him so much that his wife destroyed it
Around 1927 this American known for his mobiles created a portrait of Josephine Baker out of wire
In 1797 Goya painted this duchess, his mistress, pointing to the words "solo Goya", or "Goya alone"
Fiji's currency features this monarch on the obverse
In 1980 this country issued 2 versions of its 500-franc coin, one in French, one in Flemish
Jabal al-Noor, where the Koran began to be revealed to Muhammad, is on the reverse of its 20-riyal currency
The ouguiya of Mauritania & the Malagasy ariary of this country are the world's only non-decimal currencies
In 2006 Serbia issued several coins honoring this electricity pioneer
Jack Ryan helps avert a nuclear war in "The Sum of All Fears" by this author; thanks, Jack!
2002's "A Long Way from Home" detailed this NBC news anchor's experiences growing up in South Dakota
Never afraid to wear white after Labor Day, this author penned "A Man in Full" in 1998
In 1997 this "Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead" playwright was knighted
This ex-head of Homeland Security wrote "The Test of Our Times: America Under Siege... and How We Can Be Safe Again"
In 1780 he signed on as Massachusetts' first governor
From 1999 to 2007 Bob Taft, great-grandson of President Taft, was the governor of this state
He's the first African-American governor of New York, as well as the first to be legally blind
In January 1932 he stepped down as Louisiana governor to assume his duties as a senator
Before he ran for president, Adlai Stevenson served a term as governor of this state
Like Mom & apple pie
11th, 12th, 13th letters
"Chaste" ocean on the USA's East Coast
This model was Lincoln's first front-wheel drive car
Cobalt plane
In NATO's phonetic alphabet, this dance represents the letter "T"
It's a vigorous dance of the 1920s & also a seaport in South Carolina
The name of this ballroom dance can be used as a verb to mean "to move breezily or casually"
This swing dance is mentioned in "Wake Me Up Before You Go-Go"
It's a lively French social dance or the ball at which debutantes are presented
Abstaining from alcohol
Neutral or undecided, perhaps about the guy who sells the stolen goods
It sounds like riding young sheep, but running from the police is sometimes called being this
Receiving payment from the government, not a pineapple seller
"On the" this word means recovering from ill health
Seth Rogen voiced a mantis & Dustin Hoffman a small red panda in this 2008 movie
Voiced by John Cleese, King Harold of "Shrek" fame was originally one of these small creatures
Chemicals turn Lily Tomlin into this title "Woman" in a 1981 Joel Schumacher film
The return of 2 kidnapped fairies played by Emi & Yumi Ito caused this winged creature to stop destroying Tokyo
This 1987 film finds Dennis Quaid as a shrunken test pilot mistakenly injected into Martin Short's body

rounds.text: This word follows January (China, 1967); March (Germany, 1848); July (France, 1830) & famously, October
